summary: The Fair Housing Improvement Act of 2025 amends the Fair Housing Act to prohibit housing discrimination based on source of income (including housing vouchers and various assistance programs), veteran status, and military status. It defines these terms and makes corresponding changes to sections of the Fair Housing Act regarding prohibited activities, enforcement, and agency certifications. The bill also amends the Civil Rights Act of 1968 to prevent intimidation in fair housing cases, adding source of income, veteran status, and military status to the protected categories.
